result.execSummary:
The defendant Gage M Ksobiech was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IF REVOKED:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Court grants 111 days Credit.
Consecutive to: 15CF292

miscConds.notes: Maintain full time employment and/or school..
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with co-actors.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - First 9 months with Huber (standard release) Last 3 months STAYED, to be used at Agent's discretion as well as to the huber or straight time.

records.addlTxt: Received and filed in court by the State.

Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Gage M Ksobiech in court with attorney Jeffrey John Szczewski.

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.



Court orders the following:   
Total Prison: 30 Months.
Initial Confinement:  15 Months.
Extended Supervision:  15 Months.
111 Days Credit.
Consecutive to:  case 15CF292
STAYED.


IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


Term of Probation:  3 Years.
Concurent to: case 15CF292
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  co-actors.
DNA sample to be provided.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail - Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
1 Year in the Waukesha County Jail.
9 Months imposed forthwith- w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Defendant to be remanded to the custody of the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.
Last 3 Months - STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion -  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

Defense requests expunction.
State Objects.
Court Denies - Defense request for expunction.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 27, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Gage M Ksobiech in court with attorney Jeffrey John Szczewski.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charge. Defense counsel is requesting a sentencing date. Court grants. Defense counsel is requesting that the defendant be allowed to go to Florida for a week and half. Court allows, but he is to report twice somewhere in Florida, so WCS can still monitor him.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Gage M Ksobiech in court with attorney Jeffrey John Szczewski.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for Motion to Suppress statement. Defense counsel is requesting all witness be excluded from the courtroom. Court grants.
Attorney Elizabeth Weathers was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. Officer Brad DeGrow from the Town of Mukwonago was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. State presents exhibit #1 and #2, marked. Cross examination by the defense. Court asks questions.  Redirect by both parties. Exhibits are received. State Rests. Parties to present briefs. Briefs to be provided by 12/01/2015.  Oral ruling scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 10:30 am.
